1.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,

2.text: and said to his servants, This is John the baptist: he is risen from the dead, and because of this these works of power display their force in him.

3.text: For Herod had seized John, and had bound him and put him in prison on account of Herodias the wife of Philip his brother.

4.text: For John said to him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.

5.text: And [while] desiring to kill him, he feared the crowd, because they held him for a prophet.

6.text: But when Herod’s birthday was celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod;

7.text: whereupon he promised with oath to give her whatsoever she should ask.

8.text: But she, being set on by her mother, says, Give me here upon a dish the head of John the baptist.

9.text: And the king was grieved; but on account of the oaths, and those lying at table with [him], he commanded [it] to be given.

10.text: And he sent and beheaded John in the prison;

11.text: and his head was brought upon a dish, and was given to the damsel, and she carried [it] to her mother.

12.text: And his disciples came and took the body and buried it, and came and brought word to Jesus.

13.text: And Jesus, having heard it, went away thence by ship to a desert place apart. And the crowds having heard [of it] followed him on foot from the cities.

14.text: And going out he saw a great crowd, and was moved with compassion about them, and healed their infirm.

15.text: But when even was come, his disciples came to him saying, The place is desert, and [much of] the [day] time already gone by; dismiss the crowds, that they may go into the villages and buy food for themselves.

16.text: But Jesus said to them, They have no need to go: give ye them to eat.

17.text: But they say to him, We have not here save five loaves and two fishes.

18.text: And he said, Bring them here to me.

19.text: And having commanded the crowds to recline upon the grass, having taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed: and having broken the loaves, he gave [them] to the disciples, and the disciples [gave them] to the crowds.

20.text: And all ate and were filled, and they took up what was over and above of fragments twelve hand-baskets full.

21.text: But those that had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

22.text: And immediately he compelled the disciples to go on board ship, and to go on before him to the other side, until he should have dismissed the crowds.

23.text: And having dismissed the crowds, he went up into the mountain apart to pray. And when even was come, he was alone there,

24.text: but the ship was already in the middle of the sea tossed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.

25.text: But in the fourth watch of the night he went off to them, walking on the sea.

26.text: And the disciples, seeing him walking on the sea, were troubled, saying, It is an apparition. And they cried out through fear.

27.text: But Jesus immediately spoke to them, saying, Take courage; it is I: be not afraid.

28.text: And Peter answering him said, Lord, if it be thou, command me to come to thee upon the waters.

29.text: And he said, Come. And Peter, having descended from the ship, walked upon the waters to go to Jesus.

30.text: But seeing the wind strong he was afraid; and beginning to sink he cried out, saying, Lord, save me.

31.text: And immediately Jesus stretched out his hand and caught hold of him, and says to him, O thou of little faith, why didst thou doubt?

32.text: And when they had gone up into the ship, the wind fell.

33.text: But those in the ship came and did homage to him, saying, Truly thou art God’s Son.

34.text: And having crossed over they came to the land of Gennesaret.

35.text: And when the men of that place recognised him, they sent to that whole country around, and they brought to him all that were ill,

36.text: and besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment; and as many as touched were made thoroughly well.
